cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
G.T.59333
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 10th OCTOBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the St. Quentin front the French are west of RAGNY, west of NOYALES, west of BERNOVILLE, west of PETIT-VARLY.
The British hold VAUX-ANDIGNY, and are east of REUMONT, 2,000 yards east of TROISVILLES, 1,000 yards west of NEUVILLY, hold PRAYELLE, and west of QUIEVY, west of ST. HILAIRE, hold AVESNES, RIEUX, are west of IWUY and along the canal east of ESTRUN.
Unconfirmed reports state that our troops are in LE CATEAU.
2,500 civilians were liberated in CAUDROY.
French Front.
In the ARGONNE the French are reported to have taken SENUE.
2. ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
3. BALKAN FRONT.
The Serbians are reported to be 10 kilometres south of Nish.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
10th October, 1918.
Issued at 18.30.
